DOC.brief_title: Black Men Evolving Behavioral HIV Prevention Intervention Black MSM
DOC.detailed_description: The Specific Aims study 1 ) explicate develop intervention , 2 ) evaluate efficacy reduce HIV risk behavior 3 ) expand limit body research HIV prevention/risk reduction practice African American men sex men ( AAMSM ) . The study use randomized-controlled trial design compare receive B-ME intervention receive basic men 's health wellness messaging ( standard care ) , hypothesize : hypothesizing : participant complete B-ME intervention report great reduction sexual risk behavior standard care comparison group . The study utilize pre-test/post-test design participant randomize intervention comparison group ; strategy retain least 80 % participant study completion ; collect data baseline , 3 month post-intervention , 6 month post-intervention ; rigorously measure outcomes directly impact HIV risk . Data collect assessment point ass B-ME 's ability improve behavioral outcome directly impact Black MSM HIV risk : ( 1 ) number unprotected anal vaginal sex event ; ( 2 ) number unprotected sex event person unknown HIV status ; ( 3 ) frequency HIV testing , ( 4 ) increase communication partner sex strategy reduce risk HIV infection .
DOC.criteria: ) Be 18 55 year old b ) Self identify African American ( Black national ) c ) Self identify male ( study intervention impact change among Black MSM , self identify male include , therefore female transgendered identified person include ) . ) Report sexually active past 30 day ( ie. , one instance vaginal anal sex male female ) e ) Report least one instance unprotected anal oral sex male identify partner past year f ) Have previously participate CTCA intervention . g ) Have receive evidencebased HIV prevention intervention past 180 day Men ineligible participate trial : 1 . Identify transgender woman ; OR 2 . Plan move end study ; OR 3 . Have participate HIV substance use prevention study last 180 day .
